intro: Bignonia alba, commonly known as the white cross vine, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a deciduous vine that produces showy, white, trumpet-shaped flowers with a distinctive cross-shaped pattern on the petals. The plant belongs to the family Bignoniaceae and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and long, climbing stems. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. Bignonia alba is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is sometimes used in landscaping for its attractive floral display.
